Body: So my Galaxy S3's microUSB port is broken and it won't connect to PC. It doesn't have root. I tried rooting it but none of the methods shown on the internet gave me results (I installed the newest firmware -- my bad.) Is there a way to,1) Root my device using an app/Terminal Emulator/anything?2) Connect my device to ADB without plugging in my phone to PC and issuing  the adb tcpip 5555 command?Any help much appreciated.
Title: How can I connect to ADB on my Galaxy S3 without connecting with USB at all?

history.Text: So my Galaxy S3's microUSB port is broken and it won't connect to PC. It doesn't have root. I tried rooting it but none of the methods shown on the internet gave me results (I installed the newest firmware -- my bad.) Is there a way to,  1) Root my device using an app/Terminal Emulator/anything?  2) Connect my device to ADB without plugging in my phone to PC and issuing  the `adb tcpip 5555` command?Any help much appreciated.
How can I connect to ADB on my Galaxy S3 without connecting with USB at all?
